intro: Dianthus moesiacus subsp. sevlievensis, commonly known as the Sevlieven dianthus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
